  Thomas:

  Different people work at different levels of "e=
xtreme". For me, I prefer to 
  throw away code that doesn't work and try a=
gain. I write a test. When I am 
  confident the test is correct, I write t=
he code to make it pass. If the code 
  I write does not make the test pass=
 and I do not already know the problem, I 
  throw the code away and try ag=
ain. This minimizes debugging time. I find 
  this useful.
